entries.title: Mexicans vote in election likely to see first woman president
entries.description: After a campaign overshadowed by violence which saw dozens of local candidates killed, voters have their say.

entries.title: Israeli ministers threaten to quit over ceasefire plan
entries.description: Bezalel Smotrich and Itamar Ben-Gvir say they are opposed to striking any deal before Hamas is destroyed.

entries.title: South Africa's ANC has to share power after election blow
entries.description: Cyril Ramaphosa has led the ruling ANC to its worst result since it won the first democratic vote in 1994.

entries.title: Zelensky accuses Russia and China of undermining summit
entries.description: Both countries are trying to dissuade others from attending the upcoming event, Ukraine's president says.

entries.title: China says its spacecraft lands on Moon's far side
entries.description: The mission hopes to bring rocks back to earth from the far side of the Moon for the first time.

entries.title: Trump's White House bid goes on, lawyer tells BBC
entries.description: Donald Trump's lawyer Alina Habba tells the BBC he would run for president even if he was in jail.

entries.title: Djokovic beats Musetti in 3:07am finish in Paris
entries.description: Novak Djokovic reaches the French Open fourth round with a five-set win over Lorenzo Musetti that ends at 03:07 local time in Paris.

entries.title: India's Modi could win third term, polls predict
entries.description: Exit polls say Mr Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party is on course to win India's general election.

entries.title: Parents' marriage made Wilson 'avoid relationships'
entries.description: The Australian actor speaks about her career, childhood and recent book with Desert Island Discs.

entries.title: One dead, dozens injured in Ohio mass shooting
entries.description: At least 26 people have been injured after a shooting in the US city of Akron, police say.

entries.title: North Korea floats more rubbish-filled balloons over South Korean border
entries.description: South Korea's military has warned people to avoid touching the balloons and report them to authorities.

entries.title: Funding for project on Barbados' oldest sheet music
entries.description: The manuscript is the world’s oldest surviving music from the Caribbean island.

entries.title: 'Heartsick' Jennifer Lopez cancels US tour dates
entries.description: Ticket firm Live Nation says the singer is " taking time off to be with her children, family and close friends".

entries.title: We have no Plan B if Ukraine falls, says Estonia
entries.description: Estonia is pouring money and weapons into Ukraine’s war effort to try to push back the Russians.

entries.title: Hadid sisters donate $1m to Palestinian aid effort
entries.description: Supermodel sisters Bella and Gigi Hadid donate 1m dollars to Palestinian aid agencies

entries.title: Arrests, accusations and AI: India’s election unpacked
entries.description: On 4 June, Indians will find out who governs their country for the next five years.

entries.title: Americans react to Trump's guilty conviction
entries.description: The ex-president was found guilty on all counts of falsifying business records. Americans have mixed opinions about the verdict.

entries.title: Trump would run for president from jail, his lawyer says
entries.description: Alina Habba says Donald Trump will run for office even if he is jailed and "nothing will change" following his conviction for falsifying business records.

entries.title: ‘Aposiopesis’: Watch 12-year-old win US Spelling Bee
entries.description: Bruhat Soma correctly spelled words like ‘caixinha’ and ‘sciniph’ to take home the $50,000 prize.

entries.title: Mesmerising lava rivers as Icelandic volcano erupts
entries.description: Lava continues to spurt from from a volcanic system in Reykjanes Peninsula, after Wednesday's powerful eruption.

entries.title: District Attorney on Trump verdict: ‘I did my job’
entries.description: Alvin Bragg thanked the jury and prosecutors for their work "following the facts and the law". He said his team at the Manhattan District Attorney’s office had treated this case like they would any other, despite the defendant - a former president...

entries.title: What the ANC's legacy means for South Africa's past and future
entries.description: Can the ANC, which has dominated South Africa for 30 years, reinvent itself after a dismal election result?

entries.title: Young French leader's rise and Belgium's future existence: What to watch in EU elections
entries.description: BBC correspondents across Europe assess the national mood ahead of European Parliament elections.

entries.title: 'Darkest period of my life': Gay conversion therapy in Italy
entries.description: Rosario Lonegro was forced to enact his own funeral in a bid to strip him of his sexual proclivities.

entries.title: Will using Western weapons on Russia help Ukraine change the war?
entries.description: The latest Russian advance in the Kharkiv region has convinced Kyiv’s allies to change their policy.

entries.title: The artist 'not surprised' to be a best-seller
entries.description: Ivory Coast's Aboudia beat the likes of Damian Hirst to the top spot of a best-sellers list.
